p: Overall, M. communis L. leaves extracts showed higher DPPH scavenging activity than that of the synthetic antioxidant BHT (IC 50 = 20 µg/ml). A negative correlation was observed between IC 50 and total phenols (r = − 0.90, R 2 = 81.90), flavonoids (r = − 0.93, R 2 = 88.28) and proanthocyanidins (r = − 0.91, R 2 = 83.48) which is in accordance with data we found in literature [ 34]. Where high phenolic content is often associated with similar increase in the scavenging capacity of the radicals [ 36].
